title: Asset model workflow
content:
This section describes the metaphases and subordinate phases in the life cycle of an asset model.

The asset model workflow relies on business rules. Rules repeat from one phase to another when the end user can make a change to a field affected by a business rule during that phase. For more information about the out-of-the-box business rules defined for the asset model workflow, see Asset model process - Business rules.

Metaphase: Active

Phase Transition Description
Active Manual

The asset model is available for selection.

To make the asset model inactive, manually transition it to the Inactive phase.

Next phase: Inactive

Metaphase: Inactive (End)

Phase Transition Description
Inactive Manual

The asset model isn't available for selection.

To make the asset model active again, manually transition it to the Active phase.

Next phase: None, or return to Active

  • How to create an asset model record
  • How to edit an asset model record
